titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Missionary Ephemera Collection
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Martha H. Brundage and Martha L. Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday March 29, 2019 at 22:00

did.unittitle: Missionary Ephemera Collection
did.abstract: This collection includes a wide range of missionary ephemera, including artifacts, calendars, cards, children's materials, games, maps, posters, stamps, photographs, and lantern slides.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The items were acquired by donation and purchase.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Missionary Ephemera Collection (RG 221), Special Collections, Yale Divinity Library

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: During the height of the missionary movement of the late 19th and early 20th centuries, tens of thousands of missionaries went abroad, seeking to spread their Christian beliefs and bringing with them their devotion to Western civilization. This collection contains materials that were used to convey the missionaries' message to the people with whom they were working, including posters, broadsides, and tracts. It also includes materials used to encourage the home public to understand and support the missionary enterprise, including postcards, publications, calendars, collection boxes, artifacts, cards, and games.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid represents an inventory of "missionary ephemera" held by the Yale Divinity Library. Images of some of the materials in the collection are featured in an online exhibit: Spreading the Word: A Selection of Missionary Posters, Games, and Ephemera from the Day Missions Collection. The descriptions of materials will be refined as possible in the future and additional images made available.

More than 100 Chinese posters in this collection have been digitized and described as part of the Chinese Christian Posters project at Boston University. See http://ccposters.com/library/yale-divinity-library/.

list.item: XIII. Lantern Slides and Glass Negatives

did.unittitle: Artifacts
Collection box with art by Dennis Cusick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dennis Cusick (c. 1800–1824) was a Tuscarora painter from New York and a founder of the Iroquois Realist Style of painting. There are three images on the box, including a depiction of a Seneca schoolhouse. The box was presented to the United Foreign Missionary Society of New York by James Young.

did.unittitle: Missionary collection banks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seven banks including: Church Missionary Society Medical Mission Auxiliary Collection Bank; J.M.A. Methodist Missionary Society; London Missionary Society; The C.S.S.M. – The Missionary Helpers' Union; South American Missionary Society, "A Light That Shineth In A Dark Place"; Evangelical and Interdenominational Zambesi Mission; Mission to Mediterranean Garrisons founded by Mrs. Todd Osborne

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes a picture map of Japan for children to color, the book "Taro: A Little Boy of Japan" by Constance Burgess and Andrew Burgess, cut-out paper figures, the book "Japan: A Missionary Color Book for Children" by Theodore W. Engstrom and Paul Hubartt, and the book "Children of Japan: Selected from the around the world picture sets" by Janet Smalley and Nina Millen.

3 colored Chinese posters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One poster has ten household scenes on it. One poster shows a family learning and worshipping. One poster has some Latin at the bottom that reads, "Sexcentesimo Exeunte Anno Ab Obitu Piissimo Beati Odorici A Portunaone O.F.M. Qui Inter Primos Missionales Evangelium Sinensibus Nuntiavit Utini, Die 14 Januarii 1331-1931."

did.unittitle: 8 assorted Chinese missionary posters without any English indication of publisher.
2 Chinese posters with Bible verses on them.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: They are white posters with black Chinese characters on them. One says "What shall it profit a man – and lose his soul." The other is John 5:28-29.

did.unittitle: 4 Chinese posters published by the China Baptist Publication Society, Canton, China.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The poster labeled No. 2 is titled "Gambling Evil", the one labeled No. 3 is titled "Drinking Evil", the one labeled No. 6 is titled "The Social Evil", and the one labeled No. 7 is titled "The Drug Evil".

did.unittitle: 1 rectangular Chinese poster in red, white, and blue, with Chinese symbols and an airplane on it.
10 rectangular Chinese posters labeled "V.E. Scrolls 'Sin, Salvation, Purity, Glory.' Cat. 3088.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These posters are published by the Religious Tract Society, Hankow & Shanghai." The posters are either black, red, or yellow. The black and red posters have white symbols, while the yellow posters have red symbols.

did.unittitle: 36 rectangular Chinese posters on semi-transparent paper. The posters are either off-white, pink, peach, blue, or teal. The Chinese characters and few drawings are all in black ink.
Colored poster published by the Religious Tract Society for China, Hankow and Shanghai. There are 9 panels on the poster with different scenes of home life.
9 assorted Chinese posters in color
7 white, red, and black Chinese posters
9 posters published by the Christian Book Room, Shanghai.
5 Chinese posters published by the Religious Tract Society, Hankow & Shanghai.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All of the posters are V.E. Half Size Posters. One is labeled "A New Objective", another "The Lotus", another "A New Outlook", and the last "Sin and Death".

did.unittitle: 3 Chinese posters in a similar artistic style published by the Religious Tract Society, Hankow & Shanghai.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One is labeled "V.E. Half Size Poster 'Rich Fool' Cat. No. 3085". The second is labeled "V.E. Half Size Poster 'An Old Invitation Renewed' Cat. No. 3078". The third is labeled "V.E. Half Size Poster 'A New Friend' Cat. No. 3081".

did.unittitle: 2 Chinese posters published by the Religious Tract Society for China, Hankow and Shanghai. They are both labeled, "Cat No. 1012 'Family at prayer'". Each has five images on it and many Chinese characters.
3 Chinese posters published by the Religious Tract Society for China, Hankow and Shanghai. Each has nine panels with images of home life on them. Two are also labeled "CAT. No. 1011 'Man At Work'".
3 white, black, and green Chinese posters published by the Religious Tract Society, Hankow & Shanghai. Two of the posters are labeled "V.E. Half Size Poster 'A new Chance' Cat. No. 3082."
4 colored posters with similar layouts and symbols (images of the sea and houses).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One of them explicitly states that it was published by the Christian Book Room, which probably means that they all were.

did.unittitle: 3 posters published by the Missionary Bulletin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: They are in color and on slightly more sturdy paper than most of the posters.

did.unittitle: 4 Chinese rectangular posters published by the Religious Tract Society, Hankow. They are entitled "V.E. Scroll 'Peace and Trouble' Cat. No. 20105." The posters are all white, black, and green.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Collection of 32 posters on Egypt by The Comite Catholique Contre la Faim et pour le Developpement, or CCFD

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The CCFD was founded in France in 1961 by the Catholic Church in order to mobilize Christians in the fight against hunger. The collection is complete in every respect, including the explanatory index sheets.

did.unittitle: India
Poster entitled, "Apostle of Peace & Unity," printed by Dayals' Press Delhi and published by Paul Picture Publishers.

Numerous posters and teaching aids published by Liturgical Catechetical Institute, Goroka
Sweden
Swedish poster of "Scandinavian Missionary Flights: Member of The World Missionary Aviation Conference". The poster has a cross and a plane on it.
English language
15 Mission Pictures for 4's and 5's, Set 1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is not a complete set of the series. It includes Japan, New Mexico, Chile, Brazil, Mexico, and the Philippines. Published by the Woman's Missionary Union.

did.unittitle: Poster entitled, "A Missionary Doctor Helps People," printed by United Church Press in the USA
4 English-language posters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1) Poster entitled, "Into All the World: Your New Missionaries 1951". Published by the Board of World Missions, Presbyterian Church U.S., Nashville, TN. Includes faces of missionaries on top of a world map. 2-4) Three posters entitled, "And now in 1,000 Tongues" published by the American Bible Society, Bible House, New York City.

did.unittitle: French language

French Missionary Poster with the handwritten caption, "Souvenir de l'Ecole Saint-Jean de Ckol-Avolo (Essé) a Monsieur l'Administrateur adjoint des Polonies J.J. Delabrousse lors de son depart en conge."
Colored wood block print of the massacre of missionaries in China. Beneath the image is a short article in French about the event.
2 French-language posters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1) French-language Belgian poster that reads, "Journée Missionnaire Universelle 18 Octobre Priez, Communiez Épargnez Pour Les Missions Faites-Vous Membre De La Propagation De La Foi." 2) Movie poster for Un missionnaire, a 1954 French film by Maurice Cloche. The plot is about a Young Father, Jean Maurel, full of illusions and enthusiasm, arriving in Guinea to the mission Affob directed for 30 years by Father Gauthier. He dreams of heroic adventures and even martyrdom, but when Father Gauthier leaves Africa, he meets only disappointments and failures. He falls ill and is repatriated, but with a strengthened faith. Repaired on back.

did.unittitle: Large poster entitled "Soeurs De St. Paul De Chartres En Partance Pour Les Missions Étrangéres" with the words "Enseignantes Hospitalieres Missionnaires" on the image of missionaries and angels in a boat.
Italian language
"Beato Odorico Da Pordenone: Missionario In Cina Nel Secolo XIV" poster. A monk holds a book and points toward the sky in the image on this poster.
Poster with Christ in front of the Vatican and people from various countries at His feet. Beneath Christ the poster reads, "Omnes Gentes Servient Ei."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The title of the poster is "Sua Santità esprime il voto ardente che tutti I Fedeli si ascrivano alla Pontificia Opera della Propagazione della Fede." The date is February 2, 1928 and it lists Cardinal Gasparri as the Secretary of State.

did.unittitle: Poster of a missionary baptizing an African man with Mary in the clouds above them

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The poster reads, "La mano del Missionario potrà alrarsi sul capo dell'infedele, se la mano del Benefattore l'aiuterà a raggiungere il suo ideale." The back has various Missionary information on it.

did.unittitle: Poster entitled, "Missione Vincenziana Ricordo Dei Missionari."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On the poster, Mary is standing on the globe and around her the poster reads, "O Maria Concepita Senza Peccato Pregate Per Noi Che Ricorriamo A Voi."

did.unittitle: 3 Italian-language posters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1) 1954 Catholic Italian Missionary Poster. It reads, "Mediante la Base Missionaria l'Azione Cattolica ha già iniziato un lavoro unitario col quale esce dalle sue sedi per andare a portare la verità ai lontani ~Pius pp. XII." There is a car labeled Base Missionaria on it full of people. 2) 1953 Italian Missionary Poster Giornata Missionaria Mondiale. The subtitle reads, "La Carità Per I Poveri Di Ogni Terra Di Ogni Fede." 3) 1952 Giornata Missionaria Mondiale Italian Missionary Poster. The poster also reads, "Il Vangelo messaggio di verità di giustizia e di pace," with the precise date of October 19, 1952. The image is of a nun reading to two Asian children in a field of flowers.

did.unittitle: Spanish language
Small poster of Argentinian Ceferino Namuncura

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The poster has the words "Quiero Ser Util A Mi Gente" on it and a prayer printed on the back of it.

did.unittitle: Spanish poster with the main title, "Apostolado De La Oracion." The poster reflects Spanish missions in Africa.
Spanish poster with the main title, "Apostolado De La Oracion." The poster reflects Spanish missions around the world.
Spanish poster with the main title, "Apostolado De La Oracion." The poster reflects Spanish missions around the world.
Stamps, Stationery
Binder full of missionary stamps from various countries

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The countries represented in this binder include: Angola, Arizona, California, Canada, China, Colombia, Ethiopia, Falkland Islands, Finland, Florida, French Polynesia, Gabon, Gambia, Gilbert and Ellice Islands, Hawaii, Honduras, India, Italy, Kenya, Lesotho, Liberia, Macau, Madagascar, Magyar, Marshall Islands, Mauritania, Michigan, Namibia, New Zealand, Norfolk Island, Norway, Oregon, Papua New Guinea, Paraguay, Portugal, Republic of Equatorial Guinea, Rhodesia, Slovenia, Solomon Islands, South Africa, Spain, Spanish Guinea, Sri Lanka (Ceylon), Suriname, Sweden, Togo, Uganda, United States of America, Vietnam, Wallis and Futuna Islands, Washington, Zambia. Most of the stamps are on envelopes associated with various Missionary groups, churches, and societies, as well as with specific people.

did.unittitle: Complete set of 8 stamps of African Missions by Chocolates Batanga
Set of 8 French stamps published by Soeurs Catéchistes-Missionnaires de Marie-Immaculée
Two envelopes with stamps on them, postmarked from Liberia
Uganda and Rwanda Missionary Stamp collection containing 9 stamps

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four stamps are from Uganda and five are from Rwanda.

did.unittitle: Two sheets of vintage European Stationary with missionary themes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One sheet of the stationary has a letter written on it.

did.unittitle: First day cover of the 60th anniversary of the First Missionary Outreach Church in New Britain

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Double sided newsletter on history also enclosed. Envelope includes a stamp.

did.unittitle: First day cover with enclosed newsletter of the 150th anniversary of the first Methodist service to the Maori people

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Envelope includes a stamp.

did.unittitle: First day cover of the 50th anniversary of the first Mission on the North-East Coast of Bougainville in Papua, New Guinea

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: First day cover of the 150th anniversary of the landing of the first missionary in Tonga, Walter Lawry

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two-page newsletter on the history of the first Mission there is included. Envelope includes a stamp.

did.unittitle: Embroidery
Embroidered African Lord's Prayer Missionary Tapestry and a gold-colored picture frame

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The small gold-colored picture frame has a typewritten paper taped inside. The paper reads, "In Africa * Miss Cross' Native Girls. The Lord's Prayer Worked By One Of Miss Cross' Native Girls…………Received From Verna Hertzler While She Was A Missionary In Osaka, Japan……….Martha M. George………Given To Mrs. Gossman When Miss Cross Was Home On Furlough in 1917……."

78 r.p.m. Record used for evangelism in the South Pacific

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Original 1898 translation of the Universal Papal Hymn into the Nez-Perce language

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Worship-related
Blessing Kit from the Vincentian Foreign Missionary Society

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Blessing Kit includes Holy Water (now empty) and blessed candles.

did.unittitle: Yearbooks
3 Yearbooks entitled, "The Scroll", Northwestern Theological Seminary and Bible Training School, Minneapolis, Minnesota
Two Yearbooks entitled, "The Book of Golden Memories", Washington Missionary College, Takoma Park, Maryland
"The Missionarian", Nyack Missionary College, Nyack, New York
"Southern Memories", Southern Missionary College, Collegedale, Tennessee
Photographs
Africa
A collection of 35 photos on Missions in Uganda

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album begins with a photo of Miss F. K. Quinlan at the C.M.S. Summer School in Malvern in August, 1934. She appears again ministering to an out-patient in Uganda. There are many pictures of the construction of the church at the Sallana Mission Station. Many also on the distribution of Bibles by the Uganda Bookshop as well as the CMS. Local industry is shown in many photos. The Chapel choir at Bishop Tucker College is shown, as well as a photo of Bupoto. Also photographed are local out-patients being treated, local industry, local church elder, and the Mission station. Photos taken over a 14 year period.

did.unittitle: Collection of 15 photos on a religious procession in Leopoldville, Belgian Congo.
Collection of 6 photos of a Catholic Mission in Madagascar
12 photos of Catholic Eucharist in Elizabethville, Belgian Congo
Collection of 25 photographs of the Missions Peres Blancs in the Belgian Congo
Photo collection from the Catholic mission and hospital in Mogadishu, Italian Somaliland, during the Italian occupation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The hospital shows Italians and indigenous people. 10 large format photos all with descriptions on the back.

did.unittitle: Photo of an Italian military officer with a Catholic missionary in Eritrea.
3 photos from an early Italian Missione Cattolica in Eritrea
The photo shows the procession of Corpus Christi in Mogadishu, Somalia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photo labeled, "La processione del Corpus Domini a Mogadiscio. La testa del sacre corteo e salutata dale camicie nere."

did.unittitle: Photo of boy scouts at a Catholic Mission in Egypt

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A stamp on the back of the photograph reads, "Servizio Fotografico de 'L'Ambrosiano' Fotografie eseguite con Carte 'Gevaert'."

did.unittitle: 10 photographs (4 of them duplicates) of a gathering in Swaziland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The gathering is probably a church conference or service. The people are in western dress and in one of the photographs they are singing.

did.unittitle: Photo from the Belgian Congo. The sign reads, "Les Premiers Communiants remercient leurs Bienfaiteurs."
Collection of 6 French press photos of senior religious figures in Sub-Sahara Africa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Shown are Cardinal Malula (Zaire), Abbe Fulbert Youlou (Congo), Cardinal Zoungrana (Burkina Faso), and Bernardin Gantin (Benin).

did.unittitle: Collection of 7 press photos of the visit of King Baudouin to the Belgian Congo in 1955.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection focuses on missionary activities in the region. Shown are Monseigneur Bigirumwami, Vicaire Apostolique de Nyunde; Monseigneur Van Waeyenbergh, rector of the University of Louvain in the Congo, sisters working at the hospital for the Mining Union of Haut-Katanga, St. Boniface students, the opening of a new church, and senior Orthodox and Jewish leaders.

did.unittitle: Three photographs of the Barotse people in the area of Rhodesia. Accompanying the photographs is a brief history of the people and King Lewanika.
Collection of 16 photographs of a Mass in Rwanda, with military members and local clergy.
Collection of 6 photographs from the Mission in Malemba, Congo. Each photograph is labeled on the reverse side.
YWCA Lagos Nigeria photograph collection. Contains 13 photographs, all of which are described on the reverse side with the people identified.
A collection of 28 photographs of African people and scenes.
Photo album belonging to a husband and wife bound for the CMS Mission in Kaloleni, Kenya.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The missionaries were teachers at St. John's secondary school at the Mission. The album begins with their voyage aboard the famous ship Dunbar Castle (in 3rd class). A number of people are referenced by name. They visit St. Helena, and there are a number of photos of the locals. They also visit Durban and Capetown in South Africa, photographing churches along the way. They then make their way to British East Africa by ship, reaching Kaloleni in August. There are photos of Dr. Allen and Sister Clarke at the CMS Mission Hospial, and a panorama 3-photo collage of the Mission. There are numerous photographs of local Christianized natives, student group photo (with the two teachers), gruesome site of a dead local at the Mission hospital, and local embroidery class. There is a photo of a Mrs. Patterson aboard a train leaving Beira, found for Salisbury. The Kaloleni Mission is located in Giryama in Kilifi District in Kenya. Some of the photos contain descriptions. 117 photographs in all.

did.unittitle: Photograph album of missionaries in Africa. 97 photographs without captions. Slightly more than half of the photos show natives and native scenes.
Commerical missionary photograph album tracing the steps from the ocean voyage on the Liberty Ship Rochefort, bound for French Equatorial Africa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Visits include Mauretania, Senegal, and Gabon (St. Marie de Liberville Mission). There are also photographs of the staff of Dr. Schweitzer (Dr. Guy de Lange), the tuberculosis clinic, lepers at the mission, Dr. Emeric Percy, and construction of a building enterprise from the proceeds of the Nobel Peace Prize award in 1953. 32 photographs and a June, 1954 newspaper article on Schweitzer.

did.unittitle: Photograph album of a Girls' Mission School in Uganda. All of the photographs are labeled with names of people and places.
Photograph album of Algerian photos taken by someone interested in missionary work. Contains 78 photographs. Most of the photographs have captions.
Photograph album full of mission photos from South Africa. The photographs are all labeled and the album has the title, "Scenes in South Africa Illustrating Native Life."
Photo album belonging to a Belgian couple that visited Father Antwerpen at the Mission at Roechoebi (also known possibly as Buhonga) in Rwanda.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photo album belonging to a Belgian couple that visited Father Antwerpen at the Mission at Roechoebi (also known possibly as Buhonga) in Rwanda, 1949-1950. Also covered are the trip from Antwerp in September, 1948, Elizabethville, Honzi, Rwagonika, Indebergen, Karuzi, Costermansville, Idjenda, N'Gozi, and Karoezi. Mostly on the life of a colonial couple. Includes 62 photographs, most of which are described on their reverse sides.

did.unittitle: Photo album of Swedish missionaries in Ethiopia. Most of the photographs are labeled.
Photograph album full of photographs of scenes of the daily life of natives and a foreign missionary in Malawi. The photographs are all labeled.
3 photograph albums from a missionary in Lombolombo and Wafanya in the Belgian Congo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection with labeled photographs covers all aspects of life on a Mission station. Many missionaries and Belgian workers are shown by name. A more detailed description is included in the folder.

did.unittitle: Photograph album of missionary in Uganda and Kenya
Asia
Set of 50 large format photos of Catholic missionary activity in India and Pakistan.
11 photos from a mission in India (Fr. B). Each photo contains lengthy descriptions on the back.
Collection of 65 photographs of missionaries and mission work in Japan
Collection of 25 photos from pre-communist China taken by a Catholic priest doing missionary work, including working with lepers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some of the pictures have descriptions on the backs, such as of lepers who live outside the city walls, "kiddo" and female lepers, and groups of children described as "still pagans". There are also photos of Chinese altar boys, Chinese First Communion, men on horses, and a group of nuns in a boat. There is a mention of Father McCormack's mission. Several of the pictures mention Kongmoon South China. The priests in those pictures are Joe Sweeney and John Coulehan, as well as Bishop James E. Walsh. The picture on the ship mentions they are headed for Culivan. The group of children in front of the Temple is in Pang Yang. The group of priests was taken in Saiko. There is also mention of Tai Shan. Father Tom Malone is pictured with the lepers. There are a couple of other cities named, but the handwriting is very difficult to interpret.

did.unittitle: 8 photographs in this Anglican photograph collection from Singapore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Shown are Henry Wolfe Baines (1905-1972), Bishop of Singapore, Sister Ede, and Lady Goode (wife of the Governor) visiting the Anglican hospital. Also shown are Dr. Crow and Health Minister Bzaba. In other photographs, the children are performing a nativity play.

did.unittitle: 12 Asian photographs. Some of them are labeled with people's names including: Father Duncan, Mr. Shorock, Mrs. Jessie C. Duncan, and British Baptist missionaries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One photograph is dated 1909, but others are clearly much later. One is labeled as being taken in North-West China. Most of the photographs have no labels on them.

did.unittitle: Press photo collection of 20 photos from the French evacuation of Vietnam.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection focuses on the Catholic Mission at Go Cong on the Mekong River. According to the photo descriptions the city of Dijon adopted the refugees of Go Cong. Images of the French Chaplain General for the region is trying to understand the needs of the refugees, refugees inundating the Mission, church services, etc.

did.unittitle: Photograph album of the Protestant Mission in Amoy, China.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photographs are all labeled, including references to Hakka School, Amoy School, Chang-pu, and Kio-than Church. This album is from the Manchu period and includes 18 photos.

did.unittitle: Photo album from a missionary in New Guinea with thirteen photographs. It does not include dates or descriptions.
Photo album relating to missionary work in China by the Sisters of Charity of Vincent de Paul.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album includes photos about their work in Chusan/Zhoushan, Zhejiang, and Shanghai, and appears to refer to one nun who died in Shanghai in 1942. A word document included with the album describes the Sisters and the photo album in detail.

did.unittitle: Album of 215 photographs, all missionary content, during the warlord period in China.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images include those of Chinese pastors, Christian weddings, Sunday school, prayer meetings, war damage to churches, military hospitals, and casualties of war. Several missionaries are mentioned by name in the album.

did.unittitle: A well-documented photo album (122 photos) of the Jesuit Missionaries of Lyon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Many of the photos seem to be professional photos for the press and part of an archive. Most of the photos are dated and labeled with their location.

did.unittitle: Photograph album of Asian missions photographs. Some photos are labeled, but most are not labeled. The album is green and was originally made for post cards.
Photograph album documenting the activities and personnel of various Protestant Missionary groups, principally in Japan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Most of the many pictures contained in the album are labeled. An article describing the album is included with it.

did.unittitle: Album of photos from China and Japan
Albums of photos from India
Europe
Press photo of the Albert Schweitzer memorial in Oppenheim Germany
Photo of a group of missionaries from all over the world gathered for "Missieweek" in Belgium.
Other
Group of 5 photos of a Catholic Mission in Gonzalez, Texas. Mentioned by name are Sisters Bridget, Bernadine, and Vialo. Also a number of students mentioned.
Printed Missionary Album of missionaries from the Foreign Mission Board in Richmond, VA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some pages are missing from the album. The missionaries are grouped alphabetically under countries in the following order: China, Africa, Italy, Brazil, Argentina, Mexico, and Japan.

did.unittitle: Photo of 11 missionaries, giving their names and destinations.
Photograph of a Roman Catholic Mission School. The rest of the caption is hard to read.
Folder 1 of 2 of a Collection of 221 photographs from the archive of the Mission Society Oblats de Marie Immaculee, active in the North America polar region.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Most of the photos contain descriptions on reverse and the collection dates from 1914 to the eve of World War II. Many missionaries are identified by name, some rare photos of air, rail and river transport used by missionaries, Eskimo life, different chapel interiors, grottos, martyrs, many different missions shown by name, etc. Some of the photos contain people who were subsequently used in postcards.

did.unittitle: Folder 2 of 2 of a Collection of 221 photographs from the archive of the Mission Society Oblats de Marie Immaculee, active in the North America polar region.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Most of the photos contain descriptions on reverse and the collection dates from 1914 to the eve of World War II. Many missionaries are identified by name, some rare photos of air, rail and river transport used by missionaries, Eskimo life, different chapel interiors, grottos, martyrs, many different missions shown by name, etc. Some of the photos contain people who were subsequently used in postcards.

did.unittitle: Photo album of the Madras Conference of Missionaries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Most of the photographs have labels. The Missionaries in the album work in many different countries including India, China, Egypt, Philippines, Japan, Sri Lanka, Holland, Argentina, Mexico, Liberia, Burma, South Africa, and Java.

did.unittitle: Photographs taken by Leon V. Kofod - Africa, Asia, Iran
Photo booklet: "Reunie van de Gerepatrieerde Broeders uit Oost en West"
Seven framed photos of David Livingstone Memorial, Blantyre, Lanarkshire, Scotland
Tilburg Mission

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photo archive of the Holy Family Mission, Tilburg, Netherlands. Some photos identified in Dutch. Includes work in Indonesia, Borneo.
